thread.title: Field hockey: MKA advances in county tournament
thread.title_full: Field hockey: MKA advances in county tournament

title: Field hockey: MKA advances in county tournament
text:
Field hockey: MKA advances in county tournament October 8, 2015 Last updated: Thursday, October 8, 2015, 12:31 AM The Montclair Times Print 
Izzy Mendez scored two goals and assisted on a third to help the fourth-seeded Montclair Kimberley Academy field hockey team advance past No. 9 Livingston, 3-0, in the opening round of the Essex County Tournament Tuesday afternoon. 
The Cougars (7-5) will host fifth-seeded Mount St. Dominic in the ECT quarterfinals today, Thursday, Oct. 8, at 4 p.m. The winner of that match will move on to the semifinals, where they will visit top-seeded and four-time defending county champion West Essex at 1 p.m. 
Alix Talkow scored MKA’s other goal on Tuesday, while Caroline Taylor added an assist. 
Mendez’s two-score day was the standout senior’s fifth multi-goal game of the season. She leads MKA in both goals (14) and assists (12) this fall. 
Goalkeeper Hannah Gross stopped seven shots to earn her fourth shutout of the year. 
MKA’s next regular-season match is Tuesday afternoon at crosstown rival Montclair High. © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
